嶠字的基本解释

嶠
jiào

嶠
qiáo
均见“峤”。

嶠字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiáo］
［《廣韻》渠廟切，去笑，羣。］
［《集韻》渠嬌切，平宵，羣。］
亦作“1”。“峤1”的繁体字。
(1)本指高而锐的山。泛指高山或山岭。
(2)同“喬”。高。
(3)举步貌。
[②]［jiào］
［《廣韻》渠廟切，去笑，羣。］
亦作“2”。“峤2”的繁体字。
(1)山道。
(2)特指五岭。
(3)古曲名。

嶠字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【山字部】　嶠； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页320第08
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?渠廟切，音轎。【爾雅·釋山】山銳而高嶠。　《集韻》一曰石絕水。　又山名。【列子·湯問篇】渤海之東，其中有五山焉，二曰員嶠。　又【集韻】山逕也。【顏延之·侍遊曲阿後湖詩】山祗蹕嶠路。　又【廣韻】巨嬌切【集韻】【類篇】【韻會】渠嬌切。【正韻】祁堯切，?音喬【徐鉉曰】古通用喬。【詩·周頌】及河喬嶽。　【集韻】或作㠐。

考證：〔【爾雅·釋山】山銳而高曰嶠。〕　謹照原文省曰字。〔又陵絕水曰嶠。〕　謹按爾雅無此文，照集韻原文改作：集韻一曰石絕水。

Qiao
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiáo］
["Guangyun" Qu Miao cuts, laughs, group. ]
["Jiyun" Qu Jiaoqie, Pingxiao, group. ]
Also known as "1". Traditional characters for "峤1".
(1) This refers to high and sharp mountains. Refers to high mountains or mountains in general.
(2) Same as "Joe". high.
(3) The appearance of walking.
[②]［jiào］
["Guangyun" Qu Miao cuts, laughs, group. ]
Also called "2". "峤2" in traditional characters.
(1) Mountain road.
(2) Especially Wuling.
(3) The name of the ancient song.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Collection] [Mountain Character Department] 　峤; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 320 08
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Qu Miao cut, sound sedan. 【Erya·Shishan】The mountains are sharp and high.　"Jiyun" first says Shi Jueshui.　Also the name of the mountain. 【Liezi·Tangwen Article】East of the Bohai Sea, there are Wushanyan and Yuanqiao on the second.　[Jiyun] Mountain trails also. 【Yan Yanzhi·The Poetry of A Houhu Lake in the Poetry of a Servant Tour】Shan Zhixiu Road.　[Guang Yun] Ju Jiao cut [Ji Yun] [Class Chapter] [Yun Hui] Qu Jiao cut. [Zheng Yun] Qi Yaoqie,? Yin Qiao [Xu Xuan said] Ancient Tong Qiao. 【Poem·Zhou Song】and He Qiaoyue.　【Ji Yun】or Zuo 㠐. Textual research: [[Erya·Shishan] Shan is sharp and high, and it is called Jiao. 〕　 I would like to save the words according to the original text. 〔You Ling Jueshui said Qiao. 〔〕 　 I would like to press Erya without this article, according to the original text of Ji Yun to be changed into: Ji Yun Yi said Shi Jueshui.
